description_txt: stated on September 12, 2012 in a video posted on YouTube:
quote_txt: Says Congressman Jon Runyan has a "plan to raise Medicare costs $6,400 a year."

description_txt: stated on September 7, 2012 in campaign material:
quote_txt: The reason 29 states no longer have a death tax "is that the tax damaged their economic competitiveness."

description_txt: stated on August 21, 2012 in an opinion article in the Houston Chronicle.:
quote_txt: Says "if current trends continue, by 2040, one out of three Texas workers will not have a high school diploma."

description_txt: stated on September 10, 2012 in a Facebook post:
quote_txt: Says that under Mitt Romney, 89 million Americans could be denied coverage if they have a pre-existing condition.

description_txt: stated on September 9, 2012 in a Meet the Press interview:
quote_txt: Says five studies show his tax plan can cut rates and still bring the same revenue without raising taxes on the middle class.

description_txt: stated on September 7, 2012 in a campaign ad:
quote_txt: Under Obama, home values in Florida collapsed, construction jobs were lost and the state had a high foreclosure rate.

description_txt: stated on August 20, 2012 in a television ad:
quote_txt: After hearing "the frustrations parents and teachers have with the FCAT," next year "we begin improving our testing system."

description_txt: stated on September 2, 2012 in in an op-ed article written for Tennessee newspapers.:
quote_txt: Tennessee's appeals court judges "were selected by a handful of party officials in Nashville" before the system of "merit selection" was put into effect.

description_txt: stated on September 6, 2012 in a speech at the Democratic National Convention:
quote_txt: "With the auto rescue," President Barack Obama "saved more than 1 million middle-class jobs all across America," including more than 28,000 in Wisconsin.

description_txt: stated on September 7, 2012 in a Twitter post:
quote_txt: The U.S. unemployment rate has remained above 8 percent for 43 consecutive months, the longest stretch since the Great Depression.

description_txt: stated on August 24, 2012 in a news release:
quote_txt: "In Cuyahoga County ... 56 percent of weekend voters in 2008 were African American while adult African Americans comprise 28 percent of the county population."

description_txt: stated on September 12, 2012 in a news release:
quote_txt: David Cicilline was "required to provide key information about city finances to an independent outside auditor. The deadlines were clear -- yet [he intentionally] missed them by months" until after the November 2010 election.
footer: By C. Eugene Emery Jr. • September 14, 2012

description_txt: stated on September 11, 2012 in a news story:
quote_txt: "We just don't want to get to be like Louisiana, where you have drive-up daiquiri shops."

description_txt: stated on September 6, 2012 in a speech at the Democratic National Convention:
quote_txt: On U.S.-Israeli relations, Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu "set the record straight — he said, our two countries have 'exactly the same policy' (and) 'our security cooperation is unprecedented.'"

description_txt: stated on September 5, 2012 in remarks to Texas delegates to the Democratic National Convention.:
quote_txt: Says Rush Limbaugh made it clear he’d rather see the country fail than President Barack Obama succeed.

description_txt: stated on September 7, 2012 in an interview on NJToday:
quote_txt: "The president promised that if he spent money on a stimulus program that unemployment would go to 5.7 percent or 6 percent. Those were his words."

description_txt: stated on August 27, 2012 in an August 27, 2012 advertisement, “Not Working,” aired in and around New Hampshire.”:
quote_txt: Ann Kuster "supports the government takeover of healthcare, which robs Medicare of over $700 billion."

description_txt: stated on August 21, 2012 in a television ad, “Future.”:
quote_txt: $50,000. That's what every child owes today because Washington politicians have run up a huge spending tab and left our kids the bill."

description_txt: stated on June 9, 2012 in a speech to the Republican Party of Texas convention in Fort Worth:
quote_txt: Says Sierra Club sued him to stop oil and gas activity on Texas coast, but "we won" and "the turtles are fine."

description_txt: stated on August 30, 2012 in an interview:
quote_txt: Says President Barack Obama "built this $16 trillion debt."

description_txt: stated on September 5, 2012 in an interview on NJToday:
quote_txt: "The Senate has not passed a budget in more than three years, not a good budget, not a bad budget, no budget."

description_txt: stated on September 6, 2012 in a comment while attending the Democratic National Convention.:
quote_txt: Says that if Texas, California and New York all voted for Democratic presidential nominees, "it would be mathematically impossible for Republicans to elect a president."

description_txt: stated on August 26, 2012 in Newsletter:
quote_txt: Voter identification laws make it complicated and expensive to get an ID, essentially instituting a modern-day poll tax.

description_txt: stated on September 6, 2012 in a news release:
quote_txt: "$16 trillion (the national debt) in $1 bills would cover the entire state of Ohio nearly 1.5 times."

description_txt: stated on September 10, 2012 in a campaign press event:
quote_txt: "This would be the largest casino in the United States."

description_txt: stated on September 9, 2012 in an appearance on 'This Week.':
quote_txt: Says he and Mitt Romney "always said that we agree with the 2014 deadline" for leaving Afghanistan.

description_txt: stated on August 28, 2012 in a chain email:
quote_txt: On new dollar coins, "'In God We Trust' is gone!"

description_txt: stated on September 4, 2012 in his Democratic National Convention speech:
quote_txt: Says Obama doubled funding for the Pell Grant.

description_txt: stated on September 8, 2012 in a speech in Seminole, Fla.:
quote_txt: "We've doubled our use of renewable energy."

description_txt: stated on August 3, 2012 in a letter:
quote_txt: Says Georgia will send more state money per child to state charter schools and that budget cuts are not applied to those charter schools.
